name: Colombia
partner: Andrés Bello Foundation – Latin American Chinese Research Center
takeaway: This update of the China Index Colombia has shown variations in the results of Domains such as: media, foreign policy, economy, academia and technology; which suggest the influence of the People's Republic of China in the country has increased.

Under the current government of President Gustavo Petro and after the state visit to China in October 2023, the foreign policy Domain has shown a slight strengthening after the classification of bilateral relations under the category of "Strategic Partnership", as well as the signing of several cooperation instruments on issues such as investment and trade, rural development, education, technology and culture.
In the Economy Domain, there is a more significant variation due to the increase in investments and the development of infrastructure projects by companies from the People's Republic of China.

Although the size of the Chinese diaspora in Colombia is small compared to other countries in the region, it is worth mentioning that in recent years there has been a greater openness and receptiveness on the part of the local population to attend cultural events organized by the embassy, Confucius Institutes, businesses and the Chinese community. In addition, although there is no explicit evidence on activities developed by the UFWD, it is important to deepen research in this regard.

Finally, in the Military Domain there is no variation, which can be explained by the strong ties between Colombia and the United States, particularly in this field. However, in the research to cover the Indicators in the law enforcement Domain, doubts remain regarding the use of technology from China for the development of video surveillance activities by local and national governments, as well as the existence of an overseas PRC police base in the city of Bogota, according to a report published by Safeguard Defenders. Both elements require further investigation at the local level.
description-1: In 2023, Colombia had a GDP per capita of US$6,979 and a total population of 52.09 million people.
description-2: Colombia established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1980. Colombia was ranked 119th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 70/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.note: Colombia is not a member of the BRI. There had been talk of the possibility of joining the initiative during President Gustavo Petro's state visit to China in October 2023 but there was no confirmation. It is unclear whether Colombia would join the BRI in the future and whether that would result in membership in the Belt and Road Media Cooperation Alliance or the Belt and Road News Network, or similar organizations, which would impact the media landscape in Colombia.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Chinese media outlets do publish content in Spanish, including content on events in the country, regional news, international relations between Colombia and China, and cultural issues. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Nevertheless their number is limited and they are not at all consulted widely in the country, neither do they have a wide audience. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: During the President Gustavo Petro's most recent visit to China, a cooperation instrument was signed between the China Media Group (CMG) and the Colombian Public Media System (Rtvc) for the exchange and joint production of content. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, although audience estimates are not publicly available, it is likely that its audience and impact in the country remain low. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.note: Chinese media content is also available to Spanish-speaking audiences in Colombia through online platforms and, until recently, on pay satellite television, but its impact is very low.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
The Communications Regulation Commission supervises communications networks and services. Law 1507 of 2012 and Law 29 of 1944 both require companies to notify the CRC of any ownership changes, and all information regarding these changes is publicly available. Law 29 also bars Colombian newspapers and publishing companies from receiving subsidies from foreign governments or companies without the national government’s permission.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.note: The coverage of the China-Colombia relationship by the local media tends to have a rather neutral tone.

Media.evidence: There is no evidence that public personalities, celebrities or media commentators deny the existence of human rights abuses in the People's Republic of China. In fact, several Colombian media outlets report on these issues.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2010, the Colombo-Chinese parliamentary friendship group of the Senate of the Republic of Colombia was created and renewed in December 2023. In 2018, the Parliamentary Friendship Group between the House of Representatives of the Republic of Colombia and the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China was created and renewed in 2023. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In the context of the SARS-CoV-2 health crisis, Colombia received a donation from the PRC of US$1.5 million in May 2020 from the People's Republic of China. After the health emergency, in-kind donations continue to be contingent on the health sector. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few". However, keeping in mind the value of such donations, this indicator deserves an "Significant".
Foreign Policy.note: It is important to keep in mind cash donations, which are usually made by the People's Republic of China for natural disasters, as was the case of the donation of USD 500,000 for the reconstruction of the islands of San Andres, Providencia and Santa Catalina after Hurricane Iota in 2021.  https://www.cancilleria.gov.co/newsroom/news/gobierno-colombia-agradece-china-donacion-500000-dolares-apoyar-esfuerzos-atencion
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Foreign Policy.note: The information found for this indicator, Colombia is only mentioned in the Special Policy Study Global Green Value Chains: China's Opportunities, Challenges and Paths in the Current Economic Context, taking two examples Colombia has signed the Cocoa, Forest & Peace Initiative, which seeks to eliminate cocoa-related deforestation and Colombia has zero-deforestation agreements with the palm oil, dairy, meat and cocoa industries, in no case is there any direct and express participation in events and projects developed by CCICED. Likewise, CCIED's official website mentions the participation of former President Ivan Duque in the Leadership Dialogue organized by the Green Climate Fund in September 2020 and CCICED's official X account mentions the meeting between Minister Huang Runqiu and Carlos Correa Minister of Environment and Sustainable Development of Colombia during the United Nations High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development in August 2022.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During the state visit made by the President of Colombia, Gustavo Petro, to the People's Republic of China in October 2023, with his counterpart, Xi Jinping, both governments signed the joint declaration on the Establishment of the Strategic Partnership. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: At the end of President Gustavo Petro's State´s visit in October 2023, the joint statement expressly says that the Government of Colombia reaffirms its attachment to the principle of one China and its recognition of the Government of the People's Republic of China as the only legitimate government representing all of China and Taiwan as an inalienable part of Chinese territory. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" responde.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.note: Colombia has remained silent on any territorial disputes involving other countries in general and the case of China is not the exception. An important reason behind such a prolonged silence is likely to be Colombia's own territorial disputes, particularly with Nicaragua over the continental shelf in the Caribbean Sea, in the region where the islands of San Andres Providencia and Santa Catalina are located; an issue whose resolution may have an impact on other claims, among which, as the evidence shows, are China's disputes in the South China Sea.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.note: Colombia has made no public statements on the Uyghur sitiuation. The president, Gustavo Petro, who brands himself as a vocal defender of human rights and has spoken publicly on other issues of state abuse - such as condeming the actions of Israel towards Palestinians - has not made any comments on the plight of the Uyghur population. Colombia's Ambassador to China visited Xinjiang in August (2023) though no mention was made of the Uyghur struggle.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence:
No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the
Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s treatment of its Tibet population and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.note: This is another issue on which Colombia has remained silent. The Tibetan prime minister, Sikyong Penpa Tsering, visited the Colombian capital of Bogotá in October 2023, though did not meet with any public or state officials.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s ongoing repression in Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.note: This is another issue on which Colombia has remained silent. Colombia has a consulate in Hong Kong though it has a discreet public presence and refrains from politically charges statements or positions.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In recent years, the signing of cooperation agreements between Colombian universities/research institutes and Chinese entities, including research centers, universities and state-owned enterprises, has intensified. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a « More than a few » rating. However, the impact is still limited, since some of the agreements do not have a long duration in time and the number of universities participating in them is not a large majority. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an « Insignificant » rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are three Confucius Institutes in Colombia, two in the capital Bogotá and one in Medellín. A fourth institute is expected to open in Cali. There are also four Confucius Classrooms in the country. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a « More than a few » rating. Although they tend to be very proactive in promoting their activities, their reach and level of influence is rather limited due to the comparative volume of students and their progress beyond the initial levels of language study. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an «Insignificant » rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In November 2022 a Colombian public schooling institution began offering Mandarin lessons. As part of a pilot program carried alongside the Confucious Institute at the local Jorge Tadeo Lozano University, a public school in Bogotá has offered Mandarin lessons to 78 secondary students across two schools. However, it is a very small scale pilot project so the efficiency and impact of the programme remains to be seen. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no evidence of any Colombian think tanks or associations forming part of any such PRC-affiliated networks. There may be at least three reasons for this. One, Colombia does not belong to the BRI currently, though is exploring the option of joining in 2024. Two, there are no research centers specialized in studying China. Three, there are few experts in Colombia dedicated to studying China.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: China's educational cooperation mechanisms in Colombia have increased and strengthened in recent years. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More tan a few” raiting. There is a wide variety of scholarships granted directly by the government through the Embassy or through cooperation mechanisms with government entities and educational institutions in Colombia. Therefore, this indicator deserves an « Significant » raiting.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no evidence of any participation from Colombian experts, academics or similar in any of the aforementioned programs.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Some China researchers have been known to participate in academic programs that pay their expenses to the country. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" raiting. These programs, however, are not well publicized or have a big impact in the country. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" raiting.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are no CSSA’s or CSSA-like entities in Colombian universities or in Colombian society, most likely given extremely low numbers of Chinese students and scholars in Colombia. Therefore no evidence can be found to support this claim.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon. The Colombian education system has not seen itsefl influenced by PRC's interests or educational agenda. Colombia has a rich history of academic independence and intereference in curriculum design from foreign entities would be almost unthinkeable due to the backlash that would receive in the academic world.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon. Most academics dedicated to the study of China try to maintain a neutral position on such issues and tend to focus on other areas for the development of their research, even if they have connections with Chinese organizations.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There has been an increasing number of infrastructure agreements with SOE’s. Therefore, this Indicator deserves  a "More than a few". Though they are not signed exclusively by sub-national governments, in that the central government also plays a major role in them. Regardless, these agreements have the potential to shape the very way life is lived in the city/department. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In Colombia, there are not many agreements for the establishment of ties, either between cities and/or between departments and provinces. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The scope and impact of these agreements is rather limited. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In July 2023, a group of 8 Colombian congressmen and congresswomen took part in a week long trip to China by invitation of the Colombo-Chinese Chamber of Commerce. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. During the trip, the Colombian politicans discussed issues of bilateral trade, the development of the Metro in the capital city of Bogotá, visa agreements between the two countries, and the general strengthening of relations. However, there were no tangible agreements as a result of the trip. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In December 2023, the former mayor of Bogota, Claudia Lopez, traveled to China being the only trip made in the period observed. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The purpose of this trip was to explore and expand cooperation agreements and investment issues for the country's capital. therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.note: There are meetings between members of Colombian parties and officials of the Chinese Communist Party, but these have been within the framework of bilateral relations and their impact has not been reduced.

Economy.evidence: In the last two years, the United States has maintained its place as Colombia's main trading partner in terms of exports, followed by China in second place. However, in terms of imports, the first place has been disputed by both countries: China closing the year 2022 as the main import market for Colombia and the United States closing it in first place for the year 2023.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: According to data from the Central Bank of Colombia, in the year 2023, 51% of the sovereign debt corresponds to bonds issued in international markets. As the report by Colombia Risk Analysis "Local perceptions of Chinese investment in Colombia" points out, although the Colombian government knows in whose hands these bonds are in, it is difficult to know who is the final beneficiary of these bonds.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Economy.note:
"China is not the principal export market of any of Colombia’s extractive industry products. In crude petroleum, it is second to the United States.

"

Technology.evidence: In Colombia, the principle of technological neutrality applies, which means that there will be no discrimination of technologies according to their country of origin, so that companies such as Huawei or ZTE may provide equipment to the operators that provide the service. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Given the comparative advantages offered by their equipment and services, operators make greater use of them. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: In Colombia there are cultural celebrations organized by the Embassy, the most significant being the celebration of the lunar new year between the months of January and February of each year. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a « Few » rating.  These celebrations, in which the Chinese community also actively participates, are supported by municipal entities, educational institutions and binational cultural and business organizations and are held in the main cities of the country. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an « Significant » rating.

Therefore, this indicator deserves an « Insignificant » rating.

Society.evidence: In Colombia there are cultural exchange projects between the governments of both countries, such is the case of the Executive Program for Cultural Cooperation 2023-2027 between the Ministries of Culture of Colombia and China agreed during the state visit of President Gustavo Petro to China in October 2023. Similarly, some associations program cultural activities and have the support of the Chinese embassy in Colombia. Therefore, this indicator deserves a « Few » rating. Due to the nature of the cultural exchange agreements signed between the two governments and the wide presence of cultural activities organized in different spaces by these organizations, This indicator deserves an « Significant » rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

The few that exist refer to perceptions about Chinese investments in the country or a general perception of China. It is therefore difficult to rate this indicator.

Law Enforcement.evidence: The two countries have two relevant treaties: one on judicial assistance on criminal issues and another on the repatriation of certain Colombian prisoners in China. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no evidence of PRC-connected organized gangs operating in Colombia. There have been reports in the past of independent Chinese criminal groups and mafia organizations that have links to the criminal world throughout Colombia, but they do not have a significant presence, nor an established organizational structure in the country.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Bogota is mentioned in section « List of Chinese police jurisdictions and location of their overseas police service centers » of the report Patrol and Persuade A follow-up investigation to 110 Overseas submitted by Safeguard Defender. Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon. However, it should be noted that companies such as Hikvision have subsidiaries in the country and that some public entities have purchased video surveillance equipment from them, but this is not massive or nationwide.
